STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 29, 2024
Jennifer Schmidt
MECOSTA/OSCEOLA DHHS
800 WATER TOWER RD,
BIG RAPIDS, MI, 49307-2161
RE: License#: CP540201288
Dear Jennifer Schmidt:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on October 24, 2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way, at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-3721
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION

Licensee Group Organization: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Designee: Demetrius LuJuan Starling
Chief Administrator: Jennifer Elizabeth Schmidt
Name of Agency: MECOSTA/OSCEOLA DHHS
Agency Address: 800 WATER TOWER RD
BIG RAPIDS, MI 49307-2161
Agency Telephone #: 2317964300

Applicants for adoption, Place children for
adoption, Place children in foster home,
Supervise Independent Living

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
• (5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the
evaluation, an agency shall complete a written
report that includes all the following information:
• (a) The date the information was
received.
One of three special investigation reports reviewed did not have the report
completed within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation.
CPA Rule 400.12415 Unusual incident reporting policy
• (1) An agency must adhere to the following
incident reporting protocols:
• (a) Immediately notify the child's parents;
the department licensing authority; the
lawyer guardian ad litem and court, as
applicable; the department; and the foster
child's parents, if any of the following
occurs:

• (iv) Any medical and mental illness
or condition that results in
treatment at a hospital emergency
room or inpatient hospitalization of
a foster child.
One of three foster care files reviewed did not have documentation an incident
report was completed when a foster youth required inpatient mental health
treatment.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service
plans for each child and parent or parents, as
follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the
initial removal and at least once every 90
calendar days thereafter.
One of three foster care files reviewed had an Updated Service Plan submitted
outside of the required timeframe.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
FTM’s must occur within the required time frames as
outlined in the following tables:
Case Plan Development/Reassessment
Initial Case Plan (ISP) – within 30 calendar days before
the case plan due date.
Updated Case Plan (USP) – within 30 calendar days
before the case plan due date.
Permanent Ward Service Plan (PWSP) – within 30
calendar days before the case plan due date.
Placement Preservation/Disruption
At least three business days prior to a planned change
of placement or no later than three business days after
an unplanned change.

Planned and unplanned placement changes include
reunification, placement in a residential setting,
stepdown from a residential or hospital setting, return
from AWOLP, or request for change in foster
home/relative placements.
Two of three foster care files reviewed did not have FTM's completed as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
11/7/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 11/30/2023
FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans
When completed, obtain all signatures as appropriate,
including those of parent(s)/guardian(s), foster care
worker, supervisor,foster parent, caregiver, any youth
aged 14 and older and in the case of placement
agency foster care cases, the local DHS office
designee.
Two of three foster care files reviewed did not contain all of the required
signatures on the parent agency treatment plan (PATP).
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
11/7/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 11/30/2023
9/28/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 10/17/2022
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Annotate on signature line of PATP if mailed, emailed, refused to sign, etc.
• Licensing reports must include SOGIE and special characteristics of youth
foster home is willing to accept.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency interim inspection was completed on 11/7/23 and the CAP was approved
on 11/30/23. The agency was cited for 7 violations, 3 of which were repeated this
year. Of those 3, there was a slight increase in number of individual incidents in 1
area (PATP's). The remaining 2 areas (face-to-face and FTM's) stayed the same.
In 2022, 5 violations were established, 1 of which were repeated this year (PATP).
There was improvement with the repeated violation this year. The agency will
need to establish additional corrective planning for the repeated violations to
ensure a reduction of incidents.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The chief administrator
indicated the previous year CAP had a positive impact on overall compliance. The
agency developed an updated checklist submitted with special evaluations, ISP's,
USP's and PWSP's along with consistent use of Outlook calendar items for
reminders. In addition, the agency utilizes monthly file audits and policy in the non-
compliance areas were reviewed with staff. The Chief Administrator expressed
confidence the agency will continue to show improvement in the next review
period.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two staff were interviewed via telephone. Staff reported feeling supported by
coworkers and supervisors. There were no concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care and licensing services. All files were stored securely and
there is a cross shredder for CHRI.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety concerns identified.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
_________10/25/2024____________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
10/29/2024
_____________________________________
Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
